attributes.action: As of March 29th, all Parliamentary recesses should be cancelled.
attributes.background:
On March 29th Article 50 will be triggered. Parliament is set to recess on March 30th. 

Due to the time constraints on the UK government negotiating the UK's Brexit deal it seems appropriate to not spend quite so much of that period on holiday.
attributes.additional_details:
All Parliament's planned recesses should be abandoned.

Given the importance of the negotiations, it seems fair to assume that our Parliament is 100% committed to getting the job done. This seems unachievable if Parliament spends as much time as currently diarised on holiday and away from the task at hand.

The only way for MPs to show their commitment to we, the people, is to immediately state their intention to work wholeheartedly until the job is done.

attributes.action: Introduce licensing and strict regulation of driven grouse shooting
attributes.background: Grouse shooting is a 'sport' that relies on intensive land management to maximize bird stocking densities and therefore profit. There are many detrimental environmental effects linked to this practice, hence the need for strict legal restrictions and enforced liability of landowners.
attributes.additional_details: To sustain unnaturally high numbers of birds, reckless use of veterinary drugs is commonplace which can have unpredictable impacts on the ecosystem. Rare and protected animals such as hen-harriers are persecuted because they prey on grouse, and mountain hares are culled on mass unnecessarily. Due to frequent heather burning, local flood risk is increased and vital carbon storing peatlands are damaged. Regulation is needed due to the unwillingness of landowners to self-regulate these practices

attributes.action: Amend fixed term parliament act to account for changes of Prime Minister.
attributes.background: 3 times in the past 40 years the Prime Minister has changed without an election. The Fixed Term Parliament Act should include provision that a vote should be held within a year of a change in Prime Minister so that if the House of Commons thinks the government needs a new mandate it can get one.
attributes.additional_details:
http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/uk_politics/election_2010/8641552.stm In 2010 David Cameron announced that an unelected Prime Minister should have to call a new election within 6 months of taking office. 

Since Theresa May has become PM proposals that weren't in the 2015 Conservative manifesto have been put forward.

The vote to hold a general election requires a two thirds majority to pass. It's not unreasonable within 12 months the Commons should decide if a new mandate is required or not.

attributes.action: Reform both Houses of Parliament to 301 elected members in each house.
attributes.background: Many MPs have jobs other than their parliamentary work. They are clearly under-employed and open to the charge of lack of neutrality owing to their vested interests in their outside employment. Rewards for devoted service to the government should be adequate to ensure no need to earn elsewhere.
attributes.additional_details: The plethora of lucrative jobs now held by George Osborne has precipitated me to address this clear iniquity in the way the so called cost cutting of public services to balance our public deficit was carried out by the previous coalition government. Although many of the UKâ€™s vital public services were reduced by up to 25%, MP numbers remained constant throughout; could it be that parliamentary service is not regarded as public service? Government must show true leadership in this regard.

attributes.action: Allow parents the right to remove children from sex and relationship education.
attributes.background: The Government will table an amendment to the Children and Social Work Bill that will make sex and relationship education (SRE) part of the national curriculum in schools compulsory for children as young as 4. Its proposed parents will not be allowed the right to withdraw their children.
attributes.additional_details: Education can shape a generation. Currently there is pressure on schools from lobby groups and some MPs to promote homosexuality and impose inappropriate sex education on younger children. There are also attempts to remove the freedom that parents currently have to withdraw their children from sex education. We believe that ultimate responsibility for educating children lies with the parents, not the State.

attributes.action: Permanently move both Houses of Parliament out of the 'Westminster Village'.
attributes.background: In view of modern communications technology, there is no reason for   Parliament and the bulk of the civil service to be concentrated in a small area which is both immensely expensive and isolated from the bulk of the electorate. Let both houses move to more suitable accommodation in other cities.
attributes.additional_details: Valuation Office Agency figures suggest that the average rateable value of office space in Manchester and Birmingham is 128 per metre^2, compared to 462 in Westminster. Many departments are already responding to this challenge by relocating offices out of London. Parliament should follow suit, acquiring better equipped modern premises in provincial cities, which, beside the savings to the taxpayer, would help to remove MPs and Peers from the isolated "village" in which they work at present.

attributes.action: The government should reintroduce the dog licence which was abolished in 1987.
attributes.background: Dogs are sometimes treated by owners as controllable children. They are often not. An incredible amount of children and adults are attacked by breeds of dogs which are recognised as being so dangerous that even sizeable humans do not have the skills to tackle them. Even a lap dog can maul a baby.
attributes.additional_details: The Dog Licence was abolished in 1987. It was deemed difficult to enforce with only 50% of owners having a licence. This was pre the internet. A small charge of say Â£35 per dog or say Â£70 for a group of dogs paid online would be easy to administer. An online "ownership test" to get the licence might allow for education and enforcement of the act. It would allow the location of dangerous breeds to be known and for animal welfare and conflict with human to be reduced. It would not be onerous.

attributes.action: Give all Public Sector Workers the same pay raises across the board.
attributes.background: All Public Servants, regardless of whether they are a firefighter, NHS, Police, MOD et al they should all receive the same increases. Therefore no one group should be given a raise greater than another group. Therefore the MPs getting 10%, the same should be given to all within the Public Sector.

attributes.action: An election be held on the 4th Thursday after the death or resignation of an MP.
attributes.background: All too often a by election is delayed by the incumbent party to further their own aims.  The Constituents deserve to be represented and no delay should be permitted.

attributes.action: New EU referendum if talks fail
attributes.background: There is a high risk that EU negotiations could breakdown and or that a complex trade agreement cannot be secured within two years. Given the economic implications of this, the Government must seek a new mandate from the people before making a decision that will affect us for decades to come.
attributes.additional_details:
In March 2017 Parliament's Foreign Affairs Committee published a report on the implications of the UK not securing a deal with the EU within two years of triggering Article 50.  

Chair of the Committee, Crispin Blunt MP, said: 

"The possibility of 'no deal' is real enough to require the Government to plan how to deal with it. But there is no evidence to indicate that this is receiving the consideration it deserves or that serious contingency planning is underway."

http://bit.ly/2mf3QUV

attributes.action: Cut overseas aid from over Â£12bn a year to Â£1bn a year
attributes.background: Nhs,education,benefits,schools community programs are in the news every day telling us they don't have enough money .Let people give money to the charities they support and not be dictated to by the government.We have a rich history of giving to charities but it's time to put our citizens first.

attributes.action: Parliament to review Credit agency unfair rules.
attributes.background:
Credit agencies have set rules which can be unfair and damaging to many a young person, punishments can often be more harsh than court rulings,  also trying to sort out a problem is very difficult due to conflict ions between credit companies, and information providers,  
i give one example below.
attributes.additional_details:
Eg,
in 2012 i was ill and fell behind 3 month mortgage payments,on a second property, i sold the house paying off my missed payments in the sale, yet i was put on a delinquent list, this is now on for 6 years, this is ridiculous. the same would apply to a your post grad who made teenage mistakes, and now may have to wait 6 important years of his life to fix.
there are no ways to resolve these problems early, even criminals in jail can get time off for good behaviour, please review the rules.

attributes.action: End the inequality and offer fathers the same paternity leave as mothers.
attributes.background:
Women in the UK are entitled to paid maternity leave up to 39 weeks. 

Men only get 2 weeks.
attributes.additional_details:
To deny fathers the same benefit is unfair, unequal and sexist, the father should be available to help the mother of a new born child, a very difficult time for many families. For up to 39 weeks with pay as women are. 
Many women who have C sections or difficult births require extra care, especially if they already have an older child. 
2 weeks leave is not suitable or long enough to allow a father to bond with a new baby and to aid the recovery of his partner after child birth/C section.

attributes.action: Provide funding for external wall insulation for homes
attributes.background: Similar to recent schemes for funding of cavity wall insulation, we'd like funding for external wall insulation for homes that aren't suitable for cavity wall insulation, such as solid wall, Stone and concrete homes.
attributes.additional_details:
Live in a concrete house myself which is unsuitable for cavity wall funding. During winter we find it too unbearable with no heating on, for example waking up with frozen finger tips, toes and noses. Due to central heating costing too much as heat is lost through the walls and takes too long to heat the house up, we can't afford to have the heating on very long.

External wall insulation is too expensive for home owners to fund themselves, having been quoted around Â£15k for a 3 bed semi myself

attributes.action: Stop ministers from overuling local councils in rejected planning applications.
attributes.background: A controversial plan for 450 homes on Medwayâ€™s green lung will go ahead, after the minister has rubber stamped and ignored local residents and local councillers. This development goes against the very clear wishes of the public.
attributes.additional_details:
Durring the mornings and evenings rush hours the roads around this proposed development are jammed with too many vehicles as it.
 This area of Lordswood simply cannot cope with anymore houses. The local doctors surgerys cannot and will not see the existing patients in a timely manor, The local accident and emergency is the Medway Maritine hospital which is in continual special measures and cant cope. Drainage and water supplies are also strained

attributes.action: Start banning people with 12 or driving points as they keep getting more
attributes.background: Highway code states that anyone who gets 12 points or more MAY be banned. Why may when they have committed the crime more than once
attributes.additional_details:
New drivers in the first 2 years getting 6 points or more will lose their licence so why not driver who have more than 2 years
 I call this discrimination against new drivers and letting others get away with breaking the law

attributes.action: To hold a referendum on whether or not to we continue to pay Foreign Aid
attributes.background: The government debated, loosely, the merits of foreign aid payments as a fixed percentage of GDP back in mid 2016.  This decision needs to be taken out of the hands of government and put into the hands of the people via a referendum.  Circa Â£12bn per year is at stake to public services.
attributes.additional_details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/125692

attributes.action: Remove the statue of Oliver Cromwell outside Parliament.
attributes.background:
Although he made change for the good, he still became a ruthless dictator. Why should the following be welcomed by parliament:
Killing over 250,000 people whilst conquering Ireland, which Cromwell justified as the "righteous judgment of God upon these barbarous wretches".
attributes.additional_details: He enforced his rule using the military, with the governors who ruled England under him ex-military generals who were extremely brutal. Although Christianity or being a Puritan isn't a defined good or bad trait, he forced all to follow his religion, forcing fasts, banning any form of work on Sunday and banning any fun, like Christmas or work.

attributes.action: Simplify marriage law and remove references to sex or gender
attributes.background:
Marriage in the UK is governed by multiple acts of parliament with specific laws for civil partnership and same sex marriage.  However, the legislation still sees same sex and opposite sex couples differently.

The law should be consolidated and simplified to correct this.
attributes.additional_details:
The law on marriage should be rewritten with all references to sex, gender and/or sexual orientation removed.  Terms for unions should be standardised and include a distinction between religious and civil unions.

When changing legal gender a person should not be required to dissolve or convert an existing union.

Religious organisations should be still allowed to refuse to perform weddings which would contradict their faith but this right should not be limited to same sex marriages.

attributes.action: Ask Mr Trump to conduct his visit virtually and use money saved to support NHS
attributes.background: Her Majesty's Government, in the interest of economy, respectfully request that president Donald Trump, given his preference and aptitude for social media, conduct his visit virtually by electronic means and that the monies saved should be used immediately to support the National Health Service.

attributes.action: Make first aid training courses free
attributes.background: There is no price on life. Children should be taught first aid in school. Adults should be taught first aid at work. We should be able to act automatically when someone is in need of life-saving aid.

attributes.action: Our schools are struggling due to funding cuts. Redirect foreign aid to schools
attributes.background: Our schools are struggling http://m.bristolpost.co.uk/olympus-headteacher-asks-parents-for-donations-as-budget-cuts-drive-schools-to-crisis-point/story-30155492-detail/story.html We are paying vast amounts to countries such as India who state they have not requested or need. Redirect to schools
attributes.additional_details: Schools are discussing four day weeks, increased class sizes and parent contributions as they struggle to afford to educate children in state schools due to increasing pupil numbers. It is the children of the less affluent in society those who cannot afford private education who will suffer making the divide between rich and poor educated even wider. Although it is commendable to help other countries it should not be at the expense of our children's future and their education

attributes.action: Insist the US provides explanation as to why J. Miah was denied entry to the US.
attributes.background: Juhel Miah was denied entry to the US based on nothing tangible. Seemingly the reason doesn't even link to the disproportionate and now illegal travel ban enforced by Donald Trump's administration.
attributes.additional_details: The UK Foreign Office has even stated that no one with a British passport will be denied entry to the US - so why?

attributes.action: Provide income tax relief and remove insurance premium tax on health insurance.
attributes.background: The affordability and rapid uptake in the number of individuals and employing organisations taking out private health insurance across the uk would immediately ease the current pressure on the NHS. There would also be a rapid growth of private sector health care in the uk providing economic benefit.
attributes.additional_details: There is currently no financial incentive for individuals or organisations to take out private health care insurance.The NHS is left to pick up all the workloads and costs of large numbers of the uk population who would by choice move into private sector health care provision if the cost of premiums were lowered by incentives. This would rapidly reduce the demand on NHS services across the uk now and for the foreseeable future and stimulate growth and investment in private health care provision.

attributes.action: capita to lose the contract for moving nhs records.
attributes.background: I suffer from MS and cannot be referred to a new MS nurse because my record have not reached my new GP after 3 months and some have to wait 6 months+, its not safe.

attributes.action: The time has come for a Compulsory test for cyclists.
attributes.background: with the increase of  cycling in the UK in recent years deaths of cyclists on British roads are increasing . There is already a test but its not compulsory , the National Standards for Cycle training test known as Bike -ability.
attributes.additional_details: the death rate on Britain's roads is reducing thankfully, but the exception is with cyclist's.  I have never understood the logic of untrained people using busy roads and risking their lives daily. If a cyclist is a driver then they will have taken the driving test and know the rules of the road, but many are non drivers and are a danger to themselves and others.

attributes.action: Make it an offence to impersonate any of our emergency services.
attributes.background:
At present, in the U.K it is only an offence to impersonate a Police Officer and not any of our other emergency services.
With this loop hole, we have members of the public masquerading as Paramedics, Fire Officers and more. This leaves Police officers powerless to act.
attributes.additional_details:
I have produced a short documentary to prove my point, which you can view here.

https://youtu.be/E4k1NOhABWQ

attributes.action: Reduce alcohol duty. High duty disproportionately penalises the poor.
attributes.background: Higher prices do not prevent alcoholism. Reducing duties to a level similar to Belgium will allow, responsible, poorer drinkers to enjoy better quality drinks without having to sacrifice other things.

attributes.action: Eliminate higher rate stamp duty for small developers restoring  old properties
attributes.background: Currently buying and restoring an unihabitable Victorian house previously owned by elderly people who did not look after it. Will then sell it as an updated habitable property. Would pay stamp duty anyway as well as vat on costs of restoring and tax on completion. Higher rate sdlt too much.
attributes.additional_details: Higher rate stamp duty is an unnecessary tax preventing developers updating and restoring homes. Can make the process unviable. We will end up having derelict properties dotted around our towns and cities which could be homes.

attributes.action: Stop sanctions for Jobseekers of 4 weeks or more
attributes.background: People would have no money for food, heating, electricity, clothes and toiletries and risk becoming homeless.  The claimant commitments are too unrealistic and not everyone has access to computers for Universal jobmatch every day or skills needed.
attributes.additional_details:
JSA is only Â£72 per week and some people must pay Council tax and housing out of this.
Job centre work coaches are getting stressed about issue as they are on the front line and must implement this cruel sanctioning.  Some leave due to a conscience.

attributes.action: Allow town councils to set their own business rates
attributes.background: Small towns across the U.K. Are suffering from empty shops due in part to excessive business rates. These rates should be set locally and councils should be able to suspend temporarily in order to boast local business.
attributes.additional_details: Currently rates are set by the valuation office. They need to be set locally based on requirements and economic growth.

attributes.action: I'd like to see the NHS running the National Lottery and keeping all profits.
attributes.background:
We are losing the NHS, it needs emergency care immediately.
Lets start with the obvious and put in a line. We do have one available.
That infusion can come from the National Lottery.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of cats except from registered breeders.
attributes.background: The stray cat population is out of control. Sale of cats should be restricted to registered breeders who neuter and meet animal welfare standards.

attributes.action: Merge health and social care for the elderly and fund from increased income tax.
attributes.background: A single management line for health and social care would increase efficiency and increased taxation is the fairest way to fund proper care.  Seven day medical and social services would enable capital resources to be better utilised.

attributes.action: Institute a Parliamentary medal  for an  historic contribution to  democracy
attributes.background:
This award will be specifically for contributions to parliamentary democracy as distinct from other types of contributions to public life or to the work of the government or the crown.

 The model should be the Congressional Gold Medal of the United States
attributes.additional_details: For example without the actions of a private citizen Gina Miller  Article 50 would not have been debated in parliament. Gina a private citizen lead a movement resulting in Â a historicÂ Supreme Court judgement which will resound down the ages and clarify  the balance of power between parliament and the government. Such a historic contribution to parliamentary democracy should be recognised by the Gold Medal.

attributes.action: Article 50 bill to include an executive confirmation referendum on 30/3/2017.
attributes.background: The article 50 act needs to be passed, but should include a 2nd referendum on 30/3/ 17 askng the UK public to confirm their  wish to leave the EU, in light of a very different world outlook. Peers and MPs would be supporting the democracy of the UK, giving the people a final but now informed choice
attributes.additional_details: The politics of the world are very different than 23 June 2016, when Trump and the option of hard Brexit was not a consideration. Much of the argument on both sides has proven to be false. Any reasonable individual would think it only right and proper to reflect and review a decision made in their personal life if circumstances changed. It is only right the UK population is allowed to do the same. A 2nd leave vote would however also give the UK govt a full and informed mandate from the people.

attributes.action: Make apprenticeships available to people from the age of 12
attributes.background: School doesn't work for everyone. However it might be beneficial for some people to learn in different ways through an apprenticeship. This might help young people with autism or other similar needs who want to learn but can't be in school.

attributes.action: Greater punishment for drivers convicted of drug or alcohol offences
attributes.background: Laws already allow for higher alcohol consumption in the UK than in many other countries and yet we allow offenders to face very limited actions or penalties for what is a serious offence. Repeat offenders see no consequence for their actions regardless of if they injure or kill anyone.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2014 for example between 220 and 260 people were killed in Great Britain where at least 1 driver was over the drink drive limit
The total number of casualties of all types in drink drive accidents is 8,210. 
2015 show there were between 200 and 290 deaths in drink drive accidents AN INCREASE ON THE PREVIOUS YEAR

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for male toilets to have baby change facilities.
attributes.background: When my fiancÃ© takes out our kids and they just have male/female toilets, there are no baby change facilities in the male toilets! He either has to use the floor or do it in the car which isnt ideal. There are so many more involved dads nowadays, we need to make things more accessible for them too!

attributes.action: Suspend all new legislation and submit to an independent legal compliancy audit
attributes.background: A substantial number of recent legal cases, political events and commentaries on regulatory changes have found the Government to be in breach, de facto and de jure, of a substantial number of its legal obligations under International Law, Human Rights Law, the Constitutional Law of the UK, etc.
attributes.additional_details:
Therefore, the Government should announce legislation to suspend all proposed legislative and regulatory changes, including those made under discretionary (budgetary and departmental) competences, and submit to a full legal compliancy audit by an independent company.

This audit will assess the legality, proportionality and justiciability of current legislation and policy, as well as the role of expert partners, such as the ONS, and stakeholders, in forming Government policy and legislation.

attributes.action: MPs must have a vote on our proposed deal before reaching the EU parliament.
attributes.background: We must give our MPs the right to scrutinise the deal we're offering BEFORE the European parliament. We must show unity as a nation when going about Brexit talks and show the entire EU that any deal we proposed is back by Westminster.

attributes.action: Make Jaywalking (crossing the road in undesignated places) An Offence
attributes.background: Jaywalking has become a serious problem in the UK, pedestrians have a total disregard for traffic. It is dangerous and results in many fatal accidents. The UK has plenty of Zebra crossings and pedestrian traffic  lights. It's a matter of life & death and it's time to make it an offence.
attributes.additional_details:
Jaywalking occurs when a pedestrian crosses a road where it's not safe to do so. Examples include crossing in middle of the road, between junctions, when a traffic light is green for traffic, or not by a zebra crossing. 
In Many countries, including the Australia, Belgium, Canada, France, Israel, Poland, USA and many other Countries, Jaywalking is an Offence

attributes.action: Honour Pharmacy by restricting the number of Pharmacy schools & graduates
attributes.background: Thousands of pharmacy graduates face the possibility of never registering due to the lack of pre-reg training placements available. As a result of the surplus supply of graduates. With many large multiples reducing their commitment to pre-reg training by 50%, making the situation considerably worse.
attributes.additional_details:
It is now vital for sweeping changes to be made. If the current approach is not addressed then sadly Pharmacy "strikes" maybe around the corner. As many dissatisfied professionals feel overworked & undervalued. 

Pharmacy will end becoming an unattractive profession, one incapable of attracting the brightest & the best undergraduates & retaining the newly qualifieds. With supply exceeding demand & universities unethically profiting from it. 

www.the-pda.org/pda-proposes-cutting-student-numbers/

attributes.action: Make it law for all animal care workers to be animal first aid trained.
attributes.background: Currently, in the UK, it is not a legal requirement for animal care workers e.g. groomers, pet sitters, dog walkers, animal trainers and animal boarding, to have any animal first aid training. Through this petition we want pets to have the best care possible and ensure their welfare is paramount.
attributes.additional_details:
With this petition, we ask that it become law that ALL animal care workers have pet first aid training. As with all work places that legally must have human first aid qualified staff, we recommend that all animal-based businesses also have the same controls and measures in place that ensure staff are animal first aid trained.
Further, that animal care workers commit to undertake and continue with CPD, throughout their careers, to ensure that they have up-to-date animal first aid qualifications.

attributes.action: People on long term job seekers allowance to do free work for the local councils
attributes.background: I think people that have been on job seekers allowance for more than 3 years. Should have to work for there local councils, picking litter and other jobs such as this, so that the local councils can spend there money more wisely.

attributes.action: Make braces free for any child with a teeth issue.
attributes.background: Braces are ridiculously expensive, ranging from Â£1000 to Â£2000. Any under 18 with a teeth issue should receive free braces from the NHS, not just children with severe teeth issues.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on the relationship between the UK and the EU after the exit.
attributes.background: Give the citizens of the United Kingdom the opportunity to decide if they want to maintain the access to the European Single Market without being a member of the European Union, either through a membership of the European Economic Area or through bilateral treaties (Swiss paradigm).

Barack Obama should not be allowed to enter the UK in any capacity due to the killing of innocent Muslims by the US army whilst he was head of the US government.

attributes.action: Get rid of the national speed limit sign and just put the speed limit.
attributes.background: For example when you are driving you shouldn't have to work out the speed limit it should be on the sign it works for all the other speed limits so I don't see why it can't work for 60 and 70 mph roads
